Reviews.Title: “Cute Tucked Away Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber B
Reviews.Content: Maya Bric was a great place to stay for my first visit to Mexico. The front desk staff was very helpful and informative. The breakfast was good. And the overall experience of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: SallyB69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before we returned to UK from Cancun, so that my son could do a bit more kitesurfing. This hotel is on the pedestrian street, so its difficult to get a taxi to deliver you. We had arrived by bus from Merida, and didn't realise it was so close. Locals very helpful. Its a basic hotel, clean, with a pool. It only serves breakfast, but there is a choice and it's constantly topped up. There is a nightclub next door which starts about midnight and ends about 5am. It is what it is - a very well priced helpful hotel, not pretentious, but not the place you would choose to spend a holiday at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the middle of the city center.”
Reviews.Author: Joe F
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel which is situated in the heart of the city center of Playa del Carmen. It takes literally 10 seconds to get from your hotelroom to the main street of Playa del Carmen. Rooms have a nice modern design, are very clean and looked brand new when I was there for 2 nights in February 2012. Breakfast is included and is really copious. Don't miss it when you are there. Swimmingpools look very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for What it Is”
Reviews.Author: RiverRun33
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here for a pit stop in PDC in late December 2011. It is what it is. Not a destination and not a place I would want to spend more than a night or two while in transit but perfectly serviceable as a crash pad. We were here for about 12 hours. Beds were OK and the showers were hot. Centrally located and within walking distance of the ferry dock and the Wallmart supermercado. The owner/manager helped us arrange an inexpensive taxi to the airport which was well below the going rate for either street taxis or van services, which we greatly appreciated. Overall would use this hotel again for the same purpose but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: alenyc78
Reviews.Content: We read alot of great reviews on this hotel and I'm assuming we got unlucky with our room because I didn't find it that great. The rooms are quite basic, we had a ground floor room and the door and walls were so thin that we could hear everything going on outside by the pool. The bathroom is quite old, and definately has plumbing problems. The sink is the bedroom and had only cold water. On a positive note, I found the rooms very clean. The location is central as its right on 5th ave, but unless you're partying until 4 in the morning you'll be hearing music all night. To muffle the sounds we had the AC on all night, which however was extremely noisy (but better than music). Breakfast was good. Choice of crossaint or toast with OJ and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “perfect option in Playa”
Reviews.Author: cecileysandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few nights and it was amazing. Quiet even if it was in the 5th ave, pleasant swimming pool, a/c, wifi, patio etc. Very nice and helpful staff, the French receptionnist Mallaury is amazing. We'll definitely go back another time! The only thing that we could say is that it would be nice if they would include breakfast. It seems that they did before, but now the option is to have breakfast in the restaurant very close "Tropical", but we have to pay the same price as the other customers.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: liltravlr
Reviews.Content: booked this for $46/night on hotels.com. non-refundable but ok as I quite enjoyed it. simple room, could use more light but really quiet, considering it is surrounded by nightclubs and right on the busy main street. Perfect location, continental breakfast included at popular little cafe out front where you can get eggs for an extra $3/30 pesos. Few feet from Starbucks, nice little heated pool, and a few feet from the big beautiful beach! had to empty out the little centipedes morning, noon and night, but they don't bite! Good a/c, nice staff, I broke a glass picture frame and they didn't even charge me for it. Felt very secure, a nice little gem. Walk up to La Bodeguita del Medio for salsa dancing Tues and Wed (free lessons), Hotel Senzi for Thursdays, and Fusion for Fridays! Viva Mexico! Playa del Carmen is almost too touristy and expensive but the beach is irresistible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sandrapetinus
Reviews.Content: We stayed a day in this hotel and it was perfect. There is a swimming pool, rooms are ok( clean and Not small; the fan is working). Employees are really friendly and helpful to find places to eat or places to go. The only bad thing is that there is no breakfast... I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicklas_nystrom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maya bric for 7 days and it was great. This hotel is quiet and relaxed even though its located right on the major tourist street 5th ave. Everything in Playa del carmen is just around the corner from this hotel. Shopping, nightclubs, the beach. The inner courtyard has a pool and spots where you can relax and read a book. The staff is very helpful and can answer most of your questions. Thanks to Yurij who is working at Maya bric for his help and tips. We will return someday.

Reviews.Title: “ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ooreflex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money, clean, comfortable, in a great location with great service. The only small criticism would be that you can hear some noise at night, but I cant imagine there are many hotels on avenida 5 where you can't. I would definitely reccommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “No tv!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyguy747
Reviews.Content: Well this is roughing it No tv Rooms are clean but no safe in rooms that work Toilets are bD you can't throw tp in so Wipe and put in garbage. Doors are bad. To room loose locks Door to toilet is bad Loud music all night next door I was in room 12 second floor The good For $60 you can get better a night Pool is ok. But cloudy water. Hmmm. Bacteria.... Free breakfast Yes. And good Internet. Yes and free. But cuts out on my iPhone all the time One tv next to pool I spent alot of time at A bed That isn't soft

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaBeekeeper
Reviews.Content: Yurij was most gracious and helpful and multilingual. Hotel very clean, soft cotton sheets, 24 hour hot water, good ventilation, a safe and a dead bolt. Really what else is there. Sheila

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: bsky456
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay with the Hotel Maya Bric in Playa Del Carmen for 7 nights in Aug 2010 for the amount of $45 dollars per night for myself and my friend. After my friend and I arrived in Playa Del Carmen, we discussed our itinerary and decided that it might be best to stay one night in a town by Chichen Itza. When checking in, we asked the receptionist at the front desk of Maya Bric whether it would be possible to change our reservation because we were still unsure as to our itinerary. She said that it was possible to pay by the day, since we didn't know if we would be staying in playa del carmen for the entire week. She never spoke of any financial ramifications due to the change in reservation. She then allowed us to pay for our first night in pesos for the night. We stayed at the Maya Bric Hotel for one night, and checked out the next day at noon since we found the hotel to be rather basic. However, the day after I returned home from my trip I received my credit bill and saw that the Maya Bric Hotel has charged me $341.37, for a whole week's stay. In the hotel policy that I read online and in email from BOOKING.COM the hotel policy says: -Deposit-100% of the first night will be charged on the day of booking and is refundable -Cancellation policy if canceled up to 2 days before date of arrival, no fee will be charged. -Cancellation policy if canceled later or in case of no-show, the first night will be charged Since my friend and I did stay for one night, I assumed the cancellation policy did not apply, and if it did, we had fulfilled it since we did indeed stay one night at the Maya Bric. After many calls to the Maya Bric, with little to no success, either having messages taken down, or not speaking to the manager at all, I enlisted the help of the people at BOOKING.COM (the site I used to book this hotel). Well, they called multiple times to plead on my behalf, and the manager refused to reimburse me for my money. The hotel manager stated that they have an INTERNAL cancellation policy that states they can charge the guest the full amount of their reservation, even though I was never informed of this when speaking directly with the receptionist regarding reservation changes. Long story short, this place was dishonest in their financial dealings, leaving little to no recourse for the customer. I highly advise budget travelers look to other hotels for their stay in Playa Del Carmen, as this place is not nearly as nice as other hotels in the area for the same cost!

Reviews.Title: “One step up from a hostel”
Reviews.Author: doublechoc-chip
Reviews.Content: To give an idea of context for this review, we were a group of 3 girls (aged 20, 31 & 32)spending 5 weeks travelling through Central America. We didn't fancy roughing it in hostels, but at the same time we were on a budget and couldnt afford to splurge. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from 1st August 2010. Location: Amazing location! We arrived in Playa on the ADO bus and it was about 5 minute walk from the bus station to the hotel. The hotel is literally right on the busy main strip of Playa del carmen (restaurants, shops, Starbucks), just one row back from the beach. The beach there is beautiful and the weather was fantastic (in fact it got a bit too hot). Despite being central, when you walk through the lobby to the back (where the rooms are), the noise of people seems to vanish and you are in a gorgeous little garden oasis with a small pool and tables and chairs to sit out. Room: The room had a damp musty smell, that wasnt unbearable, but it was enough that we could smell it on our bedclothes when we took them out at the next place after this that we stayed. We had a room with 2 double beds and a/c. The bathroom was partitioned off from the main room but its walls didnt reach the ceiling fully (2-3 foot gap at the top) if that makes sense, so it wasnt exactly noise-private. Also the room had a/c, which was much needed, but it was antiquated and RIDICULOUSLY loud! I'm not a light sleeper and have never been bothered by a/c in the past, but this was so loud it was like you were on a plane. It meant that we had to wear ear plugs in the end as it was too hot to sleep without it on. I dont know if all the rooms are like that though, we might have just been unlucky. The shower was fine except that they seem to have a limited hot water supply as by the time I took a shower after my friends one day, the water was freezing cold. Otherwise the room was clean and felt safe. Breakfast: Not included. Price: For our stay, double rooms with a/c were 660 pesos a night and with fan 600 pesos per night, but I strongly recommend you get the a/c -just remember your ear plugs! Each additional person (over 2 people) is 160 pesos/night. We booked direct with the hotel via mail (info@mayabrichotel.com) and were going to pay on credit card, but when we arrived we were told that the credit card charge had gone up from 4.5% to something crazy like 15%, so paid by cash instead. Tips: Round the corner from the hotel (turn left out of the hotel and then your next left towards the beach) is a restaurant called Season Bistro whcih I highly recommend. The waitress was amazing, the food was delicious, we were offered a free drink with our meal (my friend chose red wine and must have got over 1/3 of a bottle in her glass!) and the total bill for 3 (3 main courses) came to just 460 pesos (£23). The staff here were great and so long as you dont mind the smell and the a/c noise, its a good, cheap enough place to stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honest People. Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LagoonThieves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal spot on 5th street.... Near the nightlife, beach, shops, restaurants, even near the bus station. The hotel is so solid that no noise is heard. The pool area is gorgeous and well kept. The rooms are basic, roomy, comfortable - perfect for Playa del Carmen. "Extras", i.e. TV, are available upon request. Hmmm, I wonder if they have A/C remotes. Our sink didn't have hot and cold water, but the water temp was always perfect.... I was the only one that even noticed the one knob. Yes, you have to put your t.p. in the waste basket, but you should ALWAYS do that ANYWHERE in Playa - even the expensive hotels. The staff speaks English, French, and of course-Spanish(and probably more). Great Place!!! Very Safe!!! Much of their clientele are divers - good people from around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location, nice room, clean!”
Reviews.Author: ToddWebb
Reviews.Content: This place is located directly on the "main strip" where all tourists shop. But surprisingly none of that foot traffic noise travels into the room (during the day - at night a couple local bars' noise did waft in). At $25/night I couldn't believe my luck. Apparently during busy season this place is $50/night (I did pass by other hotels offering $40/night, assuring me that $25 was a great rate). No TV was a disappointment. A/C worked great. Rooms clean. Pool was lovely, and I used it, along with a very few others. Location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in a handy location and with friendly staff and good value rooms”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdjourneys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days at the end of February. The atmosphere was quiet and very enjoyable. We stayed in room #8 which has a TV with Spanish language mostly and a small fridge. It was very comfortable. Little noisy when the surrounding bars were busy into the night but surprisingly quiet for the location. Nice little pool and area to relax and enjoy the sun during the day. Internet access worked too! Handy to the beach and all the fun of 5th Avenue. Highly recommend it for the value. Filo was very good to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Quiet Hotel in the middle of Playa”
Reviews.Author: Traveler189
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 6 days. We decided to make our trip adventurous by not booking a hotel prior to our trip. On our bus ride from Cancun airport to Playa we talked to an American who owns a condo there and she told us about Maya Bric--right on 5th Ave., cheap, and quiet. We walked about 6 or 7 blocks from the bus station to the hotel (if I remember correctly it's between Calle 8 and Calle 10 on 5th ave; it's very close to the restaurant Parilla). The entrance to the hotel is through a huge double door (that's open except for late at night when it's still unlocked), which makes it seem like you're entering a big Mexican hacienda. The hotel rooms (3 levels; about 30 rooms) overlook a medium-sized pool and tropical trees and plants scattered throughout the grounds. The rooms are average-sized for a budget hotel (we paid 550 pesos/night after a brief negotiation; the listed rate was $60, which is about 650 pesos). They were well-kept and clean. We had an AC unit but didn't use it because it costs 100 pesos extra and the fan worked fine for us (you'll probably need to use it if you visit in the summer). Overall, we were very satisfied. Because the rooms are located behind the street, it was quiet at night. That was the biggest plus for us. If you're traveling on a budget, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: KreaHalifax
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here so I could dive with the Tank Ha group. My diving experiences were excellent : very professional, thorough and pleasant. Thanks to : Roman for my first cavern dive experience ; Ivan for the night dive (and otherdives).. Martin for the 'micro' diving experience! ; Barbara for the easy afternoon dive, and the books, and finally Alejandro. Deseriee wqas always very helpful and a treat to deal with. The hotel was a little dissapointing. The web page makes it sound like there is a restaurant and a bar in the lobby, which is not true. There are many restaurants on the strip, which the hotel fronts on, and they use the Tropical for the breakfast vouchers from Tank Ha packages......I did not use mine as I found the staff did not know what ther would include, and were not very helpful about it.....so I went to the Starbuck's down the road. The rooms were clean and the staff always helpful and pleasant. And I loved the dogs : Shannon and Lola. I hope they are getting along better these days. However, the noise from 5th avenue was exceptionally loud from my room, as I was very close to that area. Maybe the rooms further in the 'complex' might be quiter. There is not space to hang your wet things. Could use a rack in the bathroom, and maybe a small dresser to unpack your things. I am allergic to cigarette smoke, so found it difficult to find a space outside with no smoking....everywhere I went, I had to leave...even around the pool, in around the dive shop before and after diving, restaurants, etc. Last year at Scuba Club Cozumel, it was a totally different experience. No smoking in the restaurant, etc. I really enjoyed diving with the Tank Ha group, and would recommend it for all levels of divers, but would not likely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy Maya Bric”
Reviews.Author: BobHalfmoonbay
Reviews.Content: Read about this place on trip advisor, took a chance and were thrilled with the result. At $60 a night in high season it was a steel. Small, clean, friendly, a great little pool and lush garden. Heck the hostel was $50 a night for 2 and for an extra $10 a night this place was well worth it. No, not fancy, not your 5 star all inclusive but thats not what we were looking for. 1 Block from the beach, right on 5th ave and close to everything. The dive shop Tank Ha [ deep water] set us up, what a great group. Best place we ate was Don Emiloes Steak and Pasta, best steak we had all trip and very reasonably priced. Playa in general was great, diving, scooters around Cozumel. mayan ruins, All native jungle tour was great. Beachs close to town crowded but we rented bikes or walked away from the mass's. Only let down was XEL HA, tourist trap. Some noise from the bar across the street, I always travel with ear plugs for a reasonand sugest you do the same. .

Reviews.Title: “Bouquets for the Bric”
Reviews.Author: JimSChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: The Mayan Bric, despite being located right off of Fifth Avenue, is very quiet and relaxing inside it's lovely confines. The interior landscape is very nice, the pool has sea turtles and the owner and staff were very friendly and most accommodating. The room was cozily utilitarian. For the economical price, one could certainly expect far, far less. We'd happily stay there again. As for the reviewer who complained about not being able to flush toilet paper, all I can say is "Welcome to Mexico, toots---Deal with it!"

Reviews.Title: “Aside from that Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?”
Reviews.Author: Warwick Traveler
Reviews.Content: The reason this hotel did get one star is due to it's location (right on 5th Avenue), the fact that despite its location it is very quiet, the working air conditioners, the pretty interior gardens, and the pleasant staff. Unfortunately, these do not outweigh the negatives of an unpleasant one-night stay at the Maya-Bric. I should say that given the cost of the hotel, accounting for its location and the time of year (Christmas-New Years), I probably should not have expected much more than I got. But I am forever the optimist. I realize that, given the many positive reviews of the facility, there is a faithful cadre of people who will disagree with me, but, hey, it's my unvarnished TripAdvisor opinion. On to the complaints: (1) Let's start out with the most disconcerting thing about the hotel: toilet paper could not be flushed down the toilet, but had to be put in the handy garbage cans provided in the bathroom - uh, I don't think so. I never ascertained the reason for this, maybe it was a post hurricane thing and is now corrected. I would definitely make sure that you can flush before you go. (2) "It's a bathroom." "It's a shower." It's a bathroom." "It's a shower." "Wait, it's a bathroom and a shower!" The bathrooms were more reminiscent of what you see in an RV, with no line of demarcation, other than a shower curtain, between the shower head and the toilet. (3) Does anyone in Mexico believe in providing sufficient light in a hotel room to read? (4) I'm sure that some day, when I'm dead and on a marble slab, I'll be laid out on a harder surface, but for now, these beds just moved into first place. Part of the problem here is that one does not go to the Riviera Maya to move this far down the hotel food chain. I have been visiting the Yucatan at least once a year for the past nine years and the changes being wrought in a place like Playa are amazing (and sometimes disappointing), but, the city has moved well beyond backwater status. Its hotels should reflect that change, and this one most certainly does not.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Bourlingueur
Reviews.Content: Good place, clean, with nice garden, little pool, one block from the beach, internet free. Bad news for back problem the matress are very very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Maya Bric”
Reviews.Author: TheHeet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maya Bric for 3 nights (November 2005), and completed my open water dive certification through the Tank Ha Dive Center. I really enjoyed the hotel. It is very simple, and clean. No tv, radio, or phone so I read a lot. They do have one computer that guests can use for email, internet, etc. Vivian (the owner) is nice and easy to deal with. The hotel is in a great location (central) on Quinta Avenida, and about a 1/2 block from the beach. If you are looking for something opulent, this is not the place. If you are looking for a clean, simple, inexpensive place to stay in PDC this will work for you. Alessandro was my dive instructor, and was excellent! He was very thorough and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Nice room”
Reviews.Author: brewmester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maya-Bric (now Tank-Ha Hotel) for one night on Feb 19 in an AC room. The room was clean and simple. The AC worked well. At night, it was not noisy at all when the AC was on (ours was on low most of the night). There is a safe in the room, a nice feature. The staff were very nice and helpful. They recommended a great local restaurant. The property is cozy, well kept, and centrally situated. You can walk a block to the beach. Overall, it is worth every penny. The room rate was well priced. I would have paid $10 more for what we got. If you need an economical place to stay in Playa, Tank-Ha is worth a look. We paid the deposit in advance by credit card and the balance upon departure in cash. Book with Vivian. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and bright”
Reviews.Author: letgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2004. The room had 2 double beds and was very clean. The hotel is in a good location on Quinta, the attractive foot mall but the noise from the nightclubs can be heard every night. We turned the fan onto high to drown out the noise. We didn't book a room with airconditioning and it wasn't necessary in December. If we had needed it we could have had it connected for an extra US$10 per night. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and there is free internet use in the lobby. There are many excellent restuarants and shops in the mall. We flew into Cancun airport and took the new direct bus service from the airport to Playa del Carmen which cost US$6.50 pp. We saw the bus counter just before exiting the arrival hall and the bus leaves every 30 minutes from the car-park to the far right of the airport exit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This will be our third year at the Maya Bric now known as the Tank Ha. The rooms are simple but very clean. Rooms are cleaned daily and look as good as the day you checked in after they have cleaned them. The staff are all very friendly and willing to help you with any concerns or questions you may have. Nice friendly staff in the office area as well. The sitting area has a TV with VCR is a nice gathering place to meet your neighbours that are staying there. The pool is sparkling and feels so good after a day of being at the beach or touring. We can't wait to get back home to the Maya Bric.

Reviews.Title: “frequent guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Maya Bric on several occassions over the last six years and find it to be great value for your money. It is clean, convenient and the staff is friendly and very helpful. The pool is located only steps from your room (very convenient!) Air conditioning is available yet we have found that with the cooler night air in March, it was not needed. The location is prime...located beside a great little place called "Tropicana" and only a couple of blocks from the beach. What more could you ask for on vacation. Sylvia manages the hotel and is always there to assisst you. We are currently planning another trip to Playa and plan to stay at the Maya Bric as we always have!
